questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have an Azure subscription.

You need to deploy an Azure AI Document Intelligence resource.

How should you complete the Azure Resource Manager (ARM) template? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer is correct. Validated.
1. Create a FormRecognizer resource
2. On the resource screen, click Export Template under automation
3. Check the template created

Microsoft.CognitiveServices is CORRECT because Azure AI Document Intelligence (formerly known as Form Recognizer) is part of the Cognitive Services suite. The correct resource type for deploying a Document Intelligence resource in an ARM template is Microsoft.CognitiveServices/accounts.

FormRecognizer is CORRECT because Azure AI Document Intelligence (formerly known as Form Recognizer) is the correct "kind" value to use for deploying a Document Intelligence resource. This kind specifies that the resource being deployed is a Form Recognizer.
In the era of AI, and in an AI exam, they expect people to remember this useless information
I checked on portal. Given answer is correct
"kind": "FormRecognizer"

The template specifies parameters like cognitiveServiceName, location, and sku.
It creates a Cognitive Services account of type CognitiveServices with the specified properties.

questions.question_text:
You are building an app named App1 that will use Azure AI Document Intelligence to extract the following data from scanned documents:

• Shipping address
• Billing address
• Customer ID
• Amount due
• Due date
• Total tax
• Subtotal

You need to identify which model to use for App1. The solution must minimize development effort.

Which model should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Azure AI Document Intelligence provides a pre-built model specifically designed for extracting common fields from invoices, such as shipping address, billing address, customer ID, amount due, due date, total tax, and subtotal. Using this pre-built model minimizes development effort as it is already trained to recognize and extract these specific fields from invoices.

C for sure

This question has nothing to do with AI, but asking me what those list of data elements belong to. What does it prove if I know they are from invoice. In real life I will know it is invoice and select an invoice model
I think is C

Selected Answer: C
C is answer.

Selected Answer: C
C "invoice" is right answer.

To extract the specified data from scanned documents with minimal development effort, you should use the invoice model. The invoice model is specifically designed to handle structured information commonly found in invoices, including shipping and billing addresses, customer IDs, amounts due, due dates, total taxes, and subtotal. Therefore, the correct choice for App1 is C. invoice

Selected Answer: C
Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/concept-invoice?view=doc-intel-4.0.0#field-extraction

questions.question_text:
You have the following data sources:

• Finance: On-premises Microsoft SQL Server database
• Sales: Azure Cosmos DB using the Core (SQL) API
• Logs: Azure Table storage
• HR: Azure SQL database

You need to ensure that you can search all the data by using the Azure AI Search REST API.

What should you do?

choices.B: Migrate the data in HR to the on-premises SQL server.
choices.C: Export the data in Finance to Azure Data Lake Storage.
choices.A: Migrate the data in HR to Azure Blob storage.
choices.D: Migrate the data in Sales to the MongoDB API.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Another repeated qn

Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
C. migrate what is on-promises to Azure

questions.question_text:
You are building an app that will process scanned expense claims and extract and label the following data:

• Merchant information
• Time of transaction
• Date of transaction
• Taxes paid
• Total cost

You need to recommend an Azure AI Document Intelligence model for the app. The solution must minimize development effort.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/concept-receipt?view=doc-intel-4.0.0

Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
d for sure

Selected Answer: D
Obviously D

Selected Answer: D
D looks correct, Copilot confirms it

Selected Answer: D
Looks like D is the correct answer

Answer is correct.
Immersive Reader can indeed provide pictures for commonly used words in text:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/immersive-reader/overview#display-pictures-for-common-words

Azure AI Document Intelligence is CORRECT because it is designed to analyze and extract key fields from documents, such as lesson plans. This service automates the process of identifying and extracting structured information from unstructured documents, minimizing the development effort required to implement this functionality.

Immersive Reader is CORRECT because it is designed to enhance reading comprehension by providing visual aids and other tools to help users understand text better. It can automatically provide pictures or visual cues for commonly used words or phrases, making it an ideal solution for a language learning context with minimal development effort.

plans: Azure AI Document Intelligence
content: Immersive Reader

confirmed by ChatGPT

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You are building a language learning solution.

You need to recommend which Azure services can be used to perform the following tasks:

• Analyze lesson plans submitted by teachers and extract key fields, such as lesson times and required texts.
• Analyze learning content and provide students with pictures that represent commonly used words or phrases in the text.

The solution must minimize development effort.

Which Azure service should you recommend for each task? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
